explains: adv. 怕人地，非常地；不正当地

sentences.en: His memory was becoming shockingly bad.
sentences.cn: 他的记忆力正变得很糟。

sentences.en: Shockingly, this useless and dangerous surgery did not end until the 1930s.
sentences.cn: 令人震惊地，这种毫无作用又危险的外科手术直到20世纪30年代才结束。

sentences.en: More shockingly, these products are often advocated by very slim models.
sentences.cn: 更令人震惊的是，这些产品通常是由非常苗条的模特推荐的。
